ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure

Class StructureDetectionModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • ch.epfl.lis.wingj.structure.StructureDetectionModule
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    EmbryoBoundariesDetection, EmbryoContourDetection, EmbryoOrientationDetection, InteractiveStructure, InteractiveStructure, PreProcessing, WDiscCenterDetection, WPouchBoundariesDetection, WPouchCenterDetection, WPouchCompartmentsDetection, WPouchContourDetection, WPouchOrientationDetection

    public abstract class StructureDetectionModule
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract class for implementing one step of the detection of a morphological structure.

    The order in which the detection modules are applied is defined in the class extending StructureDetector. An example is given in WPouchStructureDetector.

    If the module is declared as HIDDEN, the user will not be prompted during an automatic detection and no visual elements will be displayed.

    A module is executed by a structure detector using run(). After the completion of run(), the method test() returns true if the output of the module is considered successful, otherwise test() returns false. The override of test() by a module is optional (by default it will return true). If test() returns true, the method run() of the next module is called. If test() returns false, the method update() is called where adjustments can be made, for instance changing parameter values. Then the method run() will be called again until test() returns true. It is the responsability of the module to check that the module will not fall in an endless loop. Typically, an Exception can be thrown to stop the structure detection.

    Version:
    June 9, 2011
    Author:
    Thomas Schaffter (thomas.schaff...@gmail.com)

      • test

        public boolean test()
        Tests performed after run() to check the validity of the output of this module.

        If the output of the test is not true, the update() will be called to make adjustments before running run() once again followed by test().

      • update

        Updates parameter values before re-starting the detection.
